SEARCH
Package it.unicam.cs.mpgc.jbudget125576.infra.persistence

Interface CrudRepository<T,ID>

Type Parameters:
T - entity or aggregate type you are storing
ID - primary key type used to identify the entity
All Known Implementing Classes:
CategoryRepository, HibernateRepository, TransactionRepository
public interface CrudRepository<T,ID>
Very small generic persistence port. It provide a simple and boring API so adapters (Hibernate / JDBC / in-memory) can plug-in easy. It not depends on service layer and try to keep behaviour predictable, even if sometimes edges are rough.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    deleteById(ID id)
    Delete an entity by its id.

    findAll()

  • Method Details

    • findById

      Optional<T> findById(ID id)
      Find one entity by its id if present. If id is null or not found, it just return Optional.empty() and nothing else happen. No exceptions for missing, because that makes callers life easier (usually).
      Parameters:
      id - the identifier to look for
      Returns:
      an optional with entity when exist; otherwise empty

    • save

      T save(T entity)
      Save (or update) the given entity into the store. It may insert new row or update existing, depending how the underlying adapter decide based on identifiers. It should not be null or things go wierd.
      Parameters:
      entity - the instance to persist
      Returns:
      the managed instance, sometimes same as input, sometimes a different one

    • findAll

      List<T> findAll()
      Get all entities from the store. Order are usually unspecified unless adapter promises otherwise. Never returns null; empty list when nothing are there.
      Returns:
      list of entities, maybe empty but not null

    • deleteById

      void deleteById(ID id)
      Delete an entity by its id. If no entity exist with that id, nothing really happen, which is fine for most use because caller dont have to check first.
      Parameters:
      id - the identifier of the entity to remove
